lead_paragraph: SILVER--Ruth. The family of Ruth "YaYa" "Pudge" "Aunt Dolly Ruthie" "Gram" Silver (nee Sandler) is sad to announce her death on March 28th. Born August 21, 1924, she lived her entire life in New York, a city that she loved. She was predeceased by her loving husband, Leon Silver, and by her three siblings. She adored and was adored by her children and their spouses, Paula, Jerry, Steven, Jodi, Susan, and Debbi; her grandchildren, Matthew (Bianca), Jessica, Josh (Nichole), Luke, Morgan, Lee, and Lena; her great-grandchildren, Lola and Carlotta; and many others to whom she was a mighty matriarch and friend. She was a teacher, a gardener, a card shark, and a devoted member of the 92nd Street Y. Whenever anyone said "I love you," she responded, "I love you more." She meant it. Services are on Wednesday, March 30th at 11am, at the Riverside Chapel on 76th Street. In lieu of flowers, please send donations to the 92nd Street Y - Himan Brown Senior Program. 1/3
